verses.kjv: The word of the LORD also came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to me and said,

verses.kjv: Son of man, thou dwellest in the midst of a rebellious house, which have eyes to see, and see not; they have ears to hear, and hear not: for they are a rebellious house.
verses.ct: "Son of man, you live among a rebellious people. They have eyes but refuse to see, and they have ears but refuse to listen, because they are a rebellious people."

verses.kjv: Therefore, thou son of man, prepare thee stuff for removing, and remove by day in their sight; and thou shalt remove from thy place to another place in their sight: it may be they will consider, though they be a rebellious house.
verses.ct: "So, son of man, pack your belongings as if you're going into exile, and do it during the day where they can watch. Move from where you are to another place right in front of them. Perhaps they will take notice, even though they are a rebellious people."

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou bring forth thy stuff by day in their sight, as stuff for removing: and thou shalt go forth at even in their sight, as they that go forth into captivity.
verses.ct: "During the day, bring out your bags while they watch, packed like an exile's luggage. Then in the evening, leave in their sight the way captives are taken away."

verses.kjv: Dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.
verses.ct: "While they watch, dig a hole through the wall and carry your things out through it."

verses.kjv: In their sight shalt thou bear it upon thy shoulders, and carry it forth in the twilight: thou shalt cover thy face, that thou see not the ground: for I have set thee for a sign unto the house of Israel.
verses.ct: "Lift your bags onto your shoulders right in front of them and carry them out at dusk. Cover your face so you cannot see the ground, because I am making you a warning sign for the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: And I did so as I was commanded: I brought forth my stuff by day, as stuff for captivity, and in the even I digged through the wall with mine hand; I brought it forth in the twilight, and I bare it upon my shoulder in their sight.
verses.ct: So I did exactly as I was told. During the day I brought out my bags, packed like an exile's luggage. In the evening I dug through the wall with my hands. At dusk I carried everything out on my shoulder while they watched.

verses.kjv: And in the morning came the word of the LORD unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The next morning the LORD spoke to me and said,

verses.kjv: Son of man, hath not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said unto thee, What doest thou?
verses.ct: "Son of man, didn't the people of Israel — that rebellious people — ask you, 'What are you doing?'"

verses.kjv: Say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; This burden concerneth the prince in Jerusalem, and all the house of Israel that are among them.
verses.ct: "Tell them: This is what the Lord GOD says — this message concerns the ruler in Jerusalem and the entire nation of Israel living there."

verses.kjv: Say, I am your sign: like as I have done, so shall it be done unto them: they shall remove and go into captivity.
verses.ct: "Tell them, 'I am a warning sign for you. What I have acted out is what will happen to them — they will be taken away into exile.'"

verses.kjv: And the prince that is among them shall bear upon his shoulder in the twilight, and shall go forth: they shall dig through the wall to carry out thereby: he shall cover his face, that he see not the ground with his eyes.
verses.ct: "The ruler among them will hoist his belongings onto his shoulder at dusk and leave. They will dig through the wall to escape through it. He will cover his face so that he cannot see the ground with his own eyes."

verses.kjv: My net also will I spread upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare: and I will bring him to Babylon to the land of the Chaldeans; yet shall he not see it, though he shall die there.
verses.ct: "But I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my trap. I will bring him to Babylon, to the land of the Chaldeans, yet he will never see it — and he will die there."

verses.kjv: And I will scatter toward every wind all that are about him to help him, and all his bands; and I will draw out the sword after them.
verses.ct: "I will scatter to the winds everyone around him — his helpers and all his troops — and I will pursue them with the sword."

verses.kjv: And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I shall scatter them among the nations, and disperse them in the countries.
verses.ct: "Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I scatter them among the nations and spread them across foreign lands."

verses.kjv: But I will leave a few men of them from the sword, from the famine, and from the pestilence; that they may declare all their abominations among the heathen whither they come; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: "But I will spare a few of them from the sword, from famine, and from disease, so that they can confess all their disgusting practices among the nations where they end up. Then those people will know that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD also spoke to me and said,

verses.kjv: Son of man, eat thy bread with quaking, and drink thy water with trembling and with carefulness;
verses.ct: "Son of man, eat your food while shaking, and drink your water while trembling with anxiety."

verses.kjv: And say unto the people of the land, Thus saith the Lord GOD of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and of the land of Israel; They shall eat their bread with carefulness, and drink their water with astonishment, that her land may be desolate from all that is therein, because of the violence of all them that dwell therein.
verses.ct: "Then say to the people of the land: This is what the Lord GOD says about the residents of Jerusalem and the land of Israel — they will eat their food in anxiety and drink their water in horror, because their land will be stripped bare of everything in it due to the violence of everyone living there."

verses.kjv: And the cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste, and the land shall be desolate; and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: "The populated cities will be destroyed, and the land will become desolate. Then you will know that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to me again and said,

verses.kjv: Son of man, what is that proverb that ye have in the land of Israel, saying, The days are prolonged, and every vision faileth?
verses.ct: "Son of man, what is this saying you have in the land of Israel: 'Time keeps passing, and none of these visions ever come true'?"

verses.kjv: Tell them therefore, Thus saith the Lord GOD; I will make this proverb to cease, and they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel; but say unto them, The days are at hand, and the effect of every vision.
verses.ct: "So tell them: This is what the Lord GOD says — I am putting an end to this saying, and no one in Israel will use it anymore. Instead, tell them: The time has arrived, and every vision will be fulfilled."

verses.kjv: For there shall be no more any vain vision nor flattering divination within the house of Israel.
verses.ct: "There will no longer be any false visions or deceptive predictions among the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: For I am the LORD: I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I say the word, and will perform it, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: "Because I am the LORD. When I speak, what I say will happen — there will be no more delays. In your own lifetime, you rebellious people, I will speak the word and carry it out, declares the Lord GOD."

verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to me once more and said,

verses.kjv: Son of man, behold, they of the house of Israel say, The vision that he seeth is for many days to come, and he prophesieth of the times that are far off.
verses.ct: "Son of man, look — the people of Israel are saying, 'The visions he sees are about the distant future; he's prophesying about times far away.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; There shall none of my words be prolonged any more, but the word which I have spoken shall be done, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: "So tell them: This is what the Lord GOD says — none of my words will be delayed any longer. Whatever I have spoken will be accomplished, declares the Lord GOD."
